behavior change lv1: cache can be flushed to 0 value on context switch
main issue: flush trigger need to be handle by supervisor

behavior change lv1: executable code need to be in specific memory area
main issue: supervisor / programmer have to configure allowed spaces

behavior change lv1: speculation made may be reset on context switch
main issue: flush trigger need to be handle by supervisor / user to avoid side channel

behavior change lv1: executable codes are placed on random place in free memory space
an attack may smash the canary and so will be detected
main issue: overflow are checked at one time and in one places (huge time & space gap)

behavior change lv1: a ret can only reach granted functions
main issue: unusable for recursive functions, extern functions (ret to libc)

behavior change lv1: a copy of sensitive information is made another place
main issue: size limited && still accessible

behavior change lv1: a hash chain of return address is stored
main issue: hash is time consuming

behavior change lv1: control data are moved to a memory place that is not next to data
main issue: current example is not heap compatible

behavior change lv1: jump or call can only target "landing pad"
main issue: longjump (jump to libc) are not covered

behavior change lv1: branch are labelled and only branch with a defined label can be reached
main issue: longjump (jump to libc) are not covered and labels are not unique per branch

behavior change lv1: after a period presence of a cookie in binary is checked
main issue: depending on granularity memory oversize may be huge

behavior change lv1: compatibility of flow chart with an FSM is runtime checked
main issue: an FSM (hardware is necessary for each code and no interrupt is allowed

behavior change lv1: a snapshot is made at specific period and memory validity is checked using debug tools
main issue: breakpoint and external debug need to be opened

behavior change lv1: pointer are filed with metadata, if not used as predicted -> alarm
behavior is checked and if look like attacker behavior -> alarm triggered
main issue: unknown / weird implementation of attacks are not covered

behavior change lv1: branching is granted or checked depending on some criteria
branching is checked to to be same destination as asked
main issue: may need unique identifier for each branch and doesn't support longjump

behavior change lv1: memory space are tagged with metadata if behavior not allowed -> alarm
exec only if looks to act as predicted and not like an attack
main issue: signature feed to SOM is needed

behavior change lv1: a range of address are stored in secure space and jump are only made from this tab
main issue: table address leak may lead to arbitrary execution

behavior change lv1: validity of pointer is check at runtime
main issue: hash/metadata check is time consuming

behavior change lv1: instruction set is ciphered with last instruction
main issue: extreme overhead

behavior change lv1: a signature for a branch is given to an external monitor if the branch called didn't behave as predicted -> alarm
main issue: a signature need to be created for each branch
